title: History, Culture, and Film in Tuscany
yc_attrs: This course can be applied towards the Humanities and Arts Yale College distributional requirement.
description: Offered in Siena, Italy. Critically examine the cultural identity of Tuscany, as manifested in its history, art, architecture, and folklore, with a special focus on Siena. Literary and historical readings, cinematic representations of Tuscany, in-depth tours of the city's monuments and museums, as well as field trips to Florence, San Gimignano, Pisa, and the Tuscan countryside. Particular attention will be devoted to the defining ritual of Sienese life: Il Palio, the splendid medieval horse race run in the city's central Piazza del Campo. Students are responsible for all travel expenses to and from Siena, room and board costs in Italy, and any other expenses beyond tuition. Application deadline: February 15. Enrollment limited. For further information visit the Yale Summer Session Study Abroad website. Tuition: see ITAL S130/S140. Course dates: June 22-July 25.
